channel.title: Particle Engine
channel.description:
This is a particle engine I made using Jogl that I will later use in a game I make(After making some changes to it).
Please post anything you think that should be added/changed to it.
[url=http://tinypic.com/r/s12buc/7]Particle Engine Video(Updated)[/url]
[url=http://amazing-apps.com/uploads/ParticleEngine.rar]Project[/url]

@John459 wrote:

New Video Link. Click and be happy.

item.title: Particle Engine
item.dc:creator: @iKilem iKilem
item.description:
@iKilem wrote:

[quote=“John459, post:8, topic:379034”][quote author=iKilem link=topic=474888.msg3473205#msg3473205 date=1295464366]
Fraps does compress… just not very well due to time constraints (high compression would lead to lag during record process) and to preserve quality.

Protip: AviSynth + x264 to compress a second time.

Edit: Also, Fraps uses its own video format, so most people wouldn’t be able to play the video unless they had the codec.
[/quote]

Ty for that information.

Also, fraps saved the video in avi for me.[/quote]
AVI is a container format. It is different from the video format, which could be (almost) anything, from MPEG-4 to Fraps.

Read full topic

Protip: AviSynth + x264 to compress a second time.

Edit: Also, Fraps uses its own video format, so most people wouldn’t be able to play the video unless they had the codec.[/quote]

Also, fraps saved the video in avi for me.

item.title: Particle Engine
item.dc:creator: @iKilem iKilem
item.description:
@iKilem wrote:

Fraps does compress… just not very well due to time constraints (high compression would lead to lag during record process) and to preserve quality.

Protip: AviSynth + x264 to compress a second time.

Edit: Also, Fraps uses its own video format, so most people wouldn’t be able to play the video unless they had the codec.
